data.title: Nasdaq enters correction territory as stocks close lower
data.description: Wall Street has had a rocky start to the year: Stocks again finished lower Wednesday and the Nasdaq Composite closed in correction territory, defined as a minimum 10% drop from its high.

data.title: Tide is raising prices on laundry detergent
data.description: It's going to cost you more to wash your clothes.

data.title: These stocks do well when inflation is rising, Credit Suisse says
data.description: Inflation is rising at its fastest pace in 40 years, and Credit Suisse thinks these stocks will do well in this environment.

data.title: Peloton insiders sold nearly $500 million in stock before its big drop, SEC filings show
data.description: The wave of insider selling started when the stock surged past $80 in the fall of 2020, and gained momentum in 2021 as it held above $100, SEC filings show.
